page.title: 07RECREATION
page.content: {FESTIVALS. The Rose Queen Festival was begun sixty three years ago when six schoolgirls decided to hold their own "May Day". The Queen was chosen because she was the only girl in the village whose mother would let her wear her best dress on Saturday. The Festival still takes place on the lst Saturday in June. {MORRIS DANCING. A new team of Morris Dancers have been formed called the Ringheye Morris Troupe. They are a mixed team who wear clogs and silver, gold and red costumes. They have revived some of the old customs e.g. Souling (a play which takes place on November 1st). They would also like to revive 'Crabbing'(throwing crab-apples at the Vicar-locals were known as Mobberley Crabs for this reason).
